00017 #include <ucos_ii.h>

00019 
00020 #if (OS_MEM_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_MEM_PART > 0)
00021 /*
00022 *********************************************************************************************************
00023 *                                        CREATE A MEMORY PARTITION
00024 *
00025 * Description : Create a fixed-sized memory partition that will be managed by uC/OS-II.
00026 *
00027 * Arguments   : addr     is the starting address of the memory partition
00028 *
00029 *               nblks    is the number of memory blocks to create from the partition.
00030 *
00031 *               blksize  is the size (in bytes) of each block in the memory partition.
00032 *
00033 *               err      is a pointer to a variable containing an error message which will be set by
00034 *                        this function to either:
00035 *
00036 *                        OS_NO_ERR            if the memory partition has been created correctly.
00037 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_ADDR  you are specifying an invalid address for the memory 
00038 *                                             storage of the partition.
00039 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_PART  no free partitions available
00040 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_BLKS  user specified an invalid number of blocks (must be >= 2)
00041 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_SIZE  user specified an invalid block size
00042 *                                             (must be greater than the size of a pointer)
00043 * Returns    : != (OS_MEM *)0  is the partition was created
00044 *              == (OS_MEM *)0  if the partition was not created because of invalid arguments or, no
00045 *                              free partition is available.
00046 *********************************************************************************************************
00047 */
00048 
00049 OS_MEM  *OSMemCreate (void *addr, INT32U nblks, INT32U blksize, INT8U *err)
00050 {
00051     OS_MEM    *pmem;
00052     INT8U     *pblk;
00053     void     **plink;
00054     INT32U     i;
00055 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00056     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00057 #endif    
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00062     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                          /* Validate 'err'                                */
00063         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00064     }
00065     if (addr == (void *)0) {                          /* Must pass a valid address for the memory part.*/
00066         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_ADDR;
00067         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00068     }
00069     if (nblks < 2) {                                  /* Must have at least 2 blocks per partition     */
00070         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_BLKS;
00071         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00072     }
00073     if (blksize < sizeof(void *)) {                   /* Must contain space for at least a pointer     */
00074         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_SIZE;
00075         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00076     }
00077 #endif
00078     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00079     pmem = OSMemFreeList;                             /* Get next free memory partition                */
00080     if (OSMemFreeList != (OS_MEM *)0) {               /* See if pool of free partitions was empty      */
00081         OSMemFreeList = (OS_MEM *)OSMemFreeList->OSMemFreeList;
00082     }
00083     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00084     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                        /* See if we have a memory partition             */
00085         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_PART;
00086         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00087     }
00088     plink = (void **)addr;                            /* Create linked list of free memory blocks      */
00089     pblk  = (INT8U *)((INT32U)addr + blksize);
00090     for (i = 0; i < (nblks - 1); i++) {
00091        *plink = (void *)pblk;                         /* Save pointer to NEXT block in CURRENT block   */
00092         plink = (void **)pblk;                        /* Position to  NEXT      block                  */
00093         pblk  = (INT8U *)((INT32U)pblk + blksize);    /* Point to the FOLLOWING block                  */
00094     }
00095     *plink              = (void *)0;                  /* Last memory block points to NULL              */
00096     pmem->OSMemAddr     = addr;                       /* Store start address of memory partition       */
00097     pmem->OSMemFreeList = addr;                       /* Initialize pointer to pool of free blocks     */
00098     pmem->OSMemNFree    = nblks;                      /* Store number of free blocks in MCB            */
00099     pmem->OSMemNBlks    = nblks;
00100     pmem->OSMemBlkSize  = blksize;                    /* Store block size of each memory blocks        */
00101     *err                = OS_NO_ERR;
00102     return (pmem);
00103 }
00104 /*$PAGE*/
00105 /*
00106 *********************************************************************************************************
00107 *                                          GET A MEMORY BLOCK
00108 *
00109 * Description : Get a memory block from a partition
00110 *
00111 * Arguments   : pmem    is a pointer to the memory partition control block
00112 *
00113 *               err     is a pointer to a variable containing an error message which will be set by this
00114 *                       function to either:
00115 *
00116 *                       OS_NO_ERR           if the memory partition has been created correctly.
00117 *                       OS_MEM_NO_FREE_BLKS if there are no more free memory blocks to allocate to caller
00118 *                       OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pmem'
00119 *
00120 * Returns     : A pointer to a memory block if no error is detected
00121 *               A pointer to NULL if an error is detected
00122 *********************************************************************************************************
00123 */
00124 
00125 void  *OSMemGet (OS_MEM *pmem, INT8U *err)
00126 {
00127     void      *pblk;
00128 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                           /* Allocate storage for CPU status register      */
00129     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00130 #endif    
00131 
00132 
00133 
00134 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00135     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                          /* Validate 'err'                                */
00136         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00137     }
00138     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                        /* Must point to a valid memory partition        */
00139         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM;
00140         return ((OS_MEM *)0);
00141     }
00142 #endif
00143     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00144     if (pmem->OSMemNFree > 0) {                       /* See if there are any free memory blocks       */
00145         pblk                = pmem->OSMemFreeList;    /* Yes, point to next free memory block          */
00146         pmem->OSMemFreeList = *(void **)pblk;         /*      Adjust pointer to new free list          */
00147         pmem->OSMemNFree--;                           /*      One less memory block in this partition  */
00148         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00149         *err = OS_NO_ERR;                             /*      No error                                 */
00150         return (pblk);                                /*      Return memory block to caller            */
00151     }
00152     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00153     *err = OS_MEM_NO_FREE_BLKS;                       /* No,  Notify caller of empty memory partition  */
00154     return ((void *)0);                               /*      Return NULL pointer to caller            */
00155 }
00156 /*$PAGE*/
00157 /*
00158 *********************************************************************************************************
00159 *                                   GET THE NAME OF A MEMORY PARTITION
00160 *
00161 * Description: This function is used to obtain the name assigned to a memory partition.
00162 *
00163 * Arguments  : pmem      is a pointer to the memory partition
00164 *
00165 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that will receive the name of the memory partition.
00166 *
00167 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00168 *
00169 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the name was copied to 'pname'
00170 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM        if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pmem'
00171 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00172 *
00173 * Returns    : The length of the string or 0 if 'pmem' is a NULL pointer.
00174 *********************************************************************************************************
00175 */
00176 
00177 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00178 INT8U  OSMemNameGet (OS_MEM *pmem, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00179 {
00180     INT8U      len;
00181 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00182     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00183 #endif    
00184 
00185 
00186 
00187     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00188 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00189     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00190         return (0);
00191     }
00192     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                   /* Is 'pmem' a NULL pointer?                          */
00193         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                      /* Yes                                                */
00194         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM;
00195         return (0);
00196     }
00197     if (pname == (char *)0) {                    /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                         */
00198         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                      /* Yes                                                */
00199         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;
00200         return (0);
00201     }
00202 #endif
00203     len  = OS_StrCopy(pname, pmem->OSMemName);   /* Copy name from OS_MEM                              */
00204     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00205     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00206     return (len);
00207 }
00208 #endif
00209 
00210 /*$PAGE*/
00211 /*
00212 *********************************************************************************************************
00213 *                                 ASSIGN A NAME TO A MEMORY PARTITION
00214 *
00215 * Description: This function assigns a name to a memory partition.
00216 *
00217 * Arguments  : pmem      is a pointer to the memory partition
00218 *
00219 *              pname     is a pointer to an ASCII string that contains the name of the memory partition.
00220 *
00221 *              err       is a pointer to an error code that can contain one of the following values:
00222 *
00223 *                        OS_NO_ERR                  if the name was copied to 'pname'
00224 *                        OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM        if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pmem'
00225 *                        OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL          You passed a NULL pointer for 'pname'
00226 *                                                OS_MEM_NAME_TOO_LONG       if the name doesn't fit in the storage area
00227 *
00228 * Returns    : None
00229 *********************************************************************************************************
00230 */
00231 
00232 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00233 void  OSMemNameSet (OS_MEM *pmem, char *pname, INT8U *err)
00234 {
00235     INT8U      len;
00236 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00237     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00238 #endif    
00239 
00240 
00241 
00242     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00243 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00244     if (err == (INT8U *)0) {                     /* Validate 'err'                                     */
00245         return;
00246     }
00247     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                   /* Is 'pmem' a NULL pointer?                          */
00248         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                      /* Yes                                                */
00249         *err = OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM;
00250         return;
00251     }
00252     if (pname == (char *)0) {                    /* Is 'pname' a NULL pointer?                         */
00253         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();                      /* Yes                                                */
00254         *err = OS_ERR_PNAME_NULL;
00255         return;
00256     }
00257 #endif
00258     len = OS_StrLen(pname);                      /* Can we fit the string in the storage area?         */
00259     if (len > (OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE - 1)) {          /* No                                                 */
00260         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00261         *err = OS_MEM_NAME_TOO_LONG;
00262         return;
00263     } 
00264     (void)OS_StrCopy(pmem->OSMemName, pname);    /* Yes, copy name to the memory partition header      */
00265     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00266     *err = OS_NO_ERR;
00267 }
00268 #endif
00269 
00270 /*$PAGE*/
00271 /*
00272 *********************************************************************************************************
00273 *                                         RELEASE A MEMORY BLOCK
00274 *
00275 * Description : Returns a memory block to a partition
00276 *
00277 * Arguments   : pmem    is a pointer to the memory partition control block
00278 *
00279 *               pblk    is a pointer to the memory block being released.
00280 *
00281 * Returns     : OS_NO_ERR            if the memory block was inserted into the partition
00282 *               OS_MEM_FULL          if you are returning a memory block to an already FULL memory 
00283 *                                    partition (You freed more blocks than you allocated!)
00284 *               OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM  if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pmem'
00285 *               OS_MEM_INVALID_PBLK  if you passed a NULL pointer for the block to release.
00286 *********************************************************************************************************
00287 */
00288 
00289 INT8U  OSMemPut (OS_MEM *pmem, void *pblk)
00290 {
00291 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00292     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00293 #endif    
00294 
00295 
00296 
00297 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00298     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                   /* Must point to a valid memory partition             */
00299         return (OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM);
00300     }
00301     if (pblk == (void *)0) {                     /* Must release a valid block                         */
00302         return (OS_MEM_INVALID_PBLK);
00303     }
00304 #endif
00305     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00306     if (pmem->OSMemNFree >= pmem->OSMemNBlks) {  /* Make sure all blocks not already returned          */
00307         OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00308         return (OS_MEM_FULL);
00309     }
00310     *(void **)pblk      = pmem->OSMemFreeList;   /* Insert released block into free block list         */
00311     pmem->OSMemFreeList = pblk;
00312     pmem->OSMemNFree++;                          /* One more memory block in this partition            */
00313     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00314     return (OS_NO_ERR);                          /* Notify caller that memory block was released       */
00315 }
00316 /*$PAGE*/
00317 /*
00318 *********************************************************************************************************
00319 *                                          QUERY MEMORY PARTITION
00320 *
00321 * Description : This function is used to determine the number of free memory blocks and the number of
00322 *               used memory blocks from a memory partition.
00323 *
00324 * Arguments   : pmem        is a pointer to the memory partition control block
00325 *
00326 *               p_mem_data  is a pointer to a structure that will contain information about the memory
00327 *                           partition.
00328 *
00329 * Returns     : OS_NO_ERR            If no errors were found.
00330 *               OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM  if you passed a NULL pointer for 'pmem'
00331 *               OS_MEM_INVALID_PDATA if you passed a NULL pointer to the data recipient.
00332 *********************************************************************************************************
00333 */
00334 
00335 #if OS_MEM_QUERY_EN > 0
00336 INT8U  OSMemQuery (OS_MEM *pmem, OS_MEM_DATA *p_mem_data)
00337 {
00338 #if OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3                      /* Allocate storage for CPU status register           */
00339     OS_CPU_SR  cpu_sr = 0;
00340 #endif    
00341 
00342 
00343 
00344 #if OS_ARG_CHK_EN > 0
00345     if (pmem == (OS_MEM *)0) {                   /* Must point to a valid memory partition             */
00346         return (OS_MEM_INVALID_PMEM);
00347     }
00348     if (p_mem_data == (OS_MEM_DATA *)0) {        /* Must release a valid storage area for the data     */
00349         return (OS_MEM_INVALID_PDATA);
00350     }
00351 #endif
00352     OS_ENTER_CRITICAL();
00353     p_mem_data->OSAddr     = pmem->OSMemAddr;
00354     p_mem_data->OSFreeList = pmem->OSMemFreeList;
00355     p_mem_data->OSBlkSize  = pmem->OSMemBlkSize;
00356     p_mem_data->OSNBlks    = pmem->OSMemNBlks;
00357     p_mem_data->OSNFree    = pmem->OSMemNFree;
00358     OS_EXIT_CRITICAL();
00359     p_mem_data->OSNUsed    = p_mem_data->OSNBlks - p_mem_data->OSNFree;
00360     return (OS_NO_ERR);
00361 }
00362 #endif                                           /* OS_MEM_QUERY_EN                                    */
00363 /*$PAGE*/
00364 /*
00365 *********************************************************************************************************
00366 *                                    INITIALIZE MEMORY PARTITION MANAGER
00367 *
00368 * Description : This function is called by uC/OS-II to initialize the memory partition manager.  Your
00369 *               application MUST NOT call this function.
00370 *
00371 * Arguments   : none
00372 *
00373 * Returns     : none
00374 *
00375 * Note(s)    : This function is INTERNAL to uC/OS-II and your application should not call it.
00376 *********************************************************************************************************
00377 */
00378 
00379 void  OS_MemInit (void)
00380 {
00381 #if OS_MAX_MEM_PART == 1
00382     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSMemTbl[0], sizeof(OSMemTbl));   /* Clear the memory partition table          */
00383     OSMemFreeList               = (OS_MEM *)&OSMemTbl[0]; /* Point to beginning of free list           */
00384 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00385     OSMemFreeList->OSMemName[0] = '?';                    /* Unknown name                              */
00386     OSMemFreeList->OSMemName[1] = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00387 #endif
00388 #endif
00389 
00390 #if OS_MAX_MEM_PART >= 2
00391     OS_MEM  *pmem;
00392     INT16U   i;
00393 
00394 
00395     OS_MemClr((INT8U *)&OSMemTbl[0], sizeof(OSMemTbl));   /* Clear the memory partition table          */
00396     pmem = (OS_MEM *)&OSMemTbl[0];                        /* Point to memory control block (MCB)       */
00397     for (i = 0; i < (OS_MAX_MEM_PART - 1); i++) {         /* Init. list of free memory partitions      */
00398         pmem->OSMemFreeList = (void *)&OSMemTbl[i+1];     /* Chain list of free partitions             */
00399 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00400         pmem->OSMemName[0]  = '?';                        /* Unknown name                              */
00401         pmem->OSMemName[1]  = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00402 #endif
00403         pmem++;
00404     }
00405     pmem->OSMemFreeList = (void *)0;                      /* Initialize last node                      */
00406 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00407     pmem->OSMemName[0]  = '?';                            /* Unknown name                              */
00408     pmem->OSMemName[1]  = OS_ASCII_NUL;
00409 #endif
00410 
00411     OSMemFreeList       = (OS_MEM *)&OSMemTbl[0];         /* Point to beginning of free list           */
00412 #endif
00413 }
00414 #endif                                                    /* OS_MEM_EN                                 */
